scripts.say: Be it the Royal Navy's tale of Dagda's inexhaustible cauldron or the Sakura Empire's legend of the Dragon King's bottomless rice bag, from all around the world there are stories of objects which produce endless quantities of things.
Similarly, one could describe the number of Sirens emerging from within and around the stronghold as endless.
The Eagle Union forces felt confident after their initial series of easy victories, but the tides of battle have begun turning on them.
Now, they are locked in a stalemate, fighting neck and neck with the Sirens.
Geesh, who would've thought there so many of them... Sara might've underestimated them a bit.
We've still got reign over the skies so things are still in my favor, but what about the rest of you?
I've not taken incapacitating damage, but I'm concerned about my ammo reserves.
Denver's team still has a decent amount of ammo left, but we shouldn't linger here for too long!
Commander, you don't happen to have a plan, do you?
Should it come down to it, we cannot win a war of attrition with the Sirens. It's likely that if we keep pushing, we'll be quickly surrounded even if we do make it to the stronghold.
The best we can do is wait here and hold the line until our backup arrives...
That, or we could retreat beyond the Sirens' range for a while. Then we'd just need to take out the few that come chasing us.

options.content: Your reinforcements, when are they coming?
First, we have to take out the Sirens encircling us!

scripts.say: Whichever you decide, I'll follow your orders, Commander.
They told us they're making their way here as fast as they can.
But that's not to say they'll be here any second now.
Then I guess retreating to a safer area is our only choice.
Well look at you, aren't you a real strategizer!
Guess I'll rev up the ol' engine and help too. I can't promise you I'll kick much Siren butt at all, but it's better than me doing nothing, right?
